data.title: James Stewart: A Golden Star
data.meta_description: Just like one of my very favourite actresses, Grace Kelly, James Stewart was born in Pennsylvania. I'm happy to have seen this garden state twice in my life, when I was on my way to Washington DC... I can't remember exactly what was the very first James Stewart's film I saw, but it was probably‚Ä¶
data.text:
Just like one of my very favourite actresses, Grace Kelly, James Stewart was born in Pennsylvania. I‚Äôm happy to have seen this garden state twice in my life, when I was on my way to Washington DC‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt remember exactly what was the very first James Stewart‚Äôs film I saw, but it was probably an Hitchcock‚Äôs film. Vertigo? Rear Window? Or maybe it was something completely different like It‚Äôs a Wonderful Life. Well, one thing is sure, it immediately gave me a good impression of James Stewart. Actually, the first time I SEE him was in my book, ‚ÄúLes Stars de Cin√©ma‚Äù. Just with a simple photo, I was curious to see his films. My first number one favourite actor was Marlon Brando but, one day, I said to myself: ‚ÄúNaaah, it‚Äôs not Brando anymore, it‚Äôs James Stewart‚Äù. I was a little sad to put Brando in the second place (and he still is my second favourite actor, which is really good), but now I have no regrets because, today, if someone asks me who is my favourite actor, I can proudly say, with joy in my voice, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs James Stewart!‚Äù üòÄ I decided to write this tribute to him because, yesterday, on May 20th 2015, we were glad to celebrate his 107‚Äôs birthday! That seems old but Jimmy unfortunately left us in 1997 at the noble age of 89. As he was a wonderful man and a wonderful actor, we would have whished that he lived forever. Anyway, let‚Äôs not talk about sad things, let‚Äôs talk about Jimmy, my love for Jimmy.

I must admit, I appreciate James Stewart very much as an actor and from what I‚Äôve read, I know he was someone with a great personality, a kind, and courageous man. However, as I‚Äôve never read a biography, I can‚Äôt say I know him perfectly. What is his best biography book? If you have suggestions, please tell me, I‚Äôll be so happy to discover another side of my favourite actor. If you remember my Audrey Hepburn‚Äôs text tribute that I‚Äôve written not a long time ago, you know that I mentioned that, when I see her make her first entrance in a film, it always makes me smile. Well, that‚Äôs the same story with James Stewart. I can‚Äôt help having a big smile and saying to myself ‚ÄúAww, that‚Äôs my Jimmy!‚Äù ‚ù§ It‚Äôs also an actor with whom I would have liked to be friend. Well, I‚Äôve met James Stewart‚Ä¶ in a dream. Better than nothing isn‚Äôt it? Oh, and Hitchcock was in my dream as well and signed me his autograph. In every James Stewart‚Äôs films I saw, there‚Äôs always something that makes him nice in a way or another, even in Vertigo where he plays a‚Ä¶ necrophile (well, sort of). We agree, Scottie is not very nice with Judy but, at the beginning of the film, before the real problems start, he seems to be a nice fellow to hang out with. His only problem is his acrophobia. Anyway, let‚Äôs not forget that this is a film, it‚Äôs not the real Jimmy. It‚Äôs only one of the numerous things that prooves us that he was an incredible actor and that he was capable of a great versatility.

Before I wrote this text, I calculated how many James Stewart I‚Äôve seen so far. That‚Äôs a total of 13 films. You may wonder which one is my favourite. It is, without any doubts, It‚Äôs a Wonderful Life. You may have noticed that the logo of this blog is a picture of this film. Everything‚Äôs perfect about this movie, not to mention that it is also my 3rd favourite film of all times and also my favourite James Stewart‚Äôs performance. It‚Äôs a Wonderful Life was also James Stewart‚Äôs personal favourite (among his films). He indeed said some great things about this gem: ‚ÄúSuch a pure movie. It wasn‚Äôt taken from a novel or a play. It was developed from one little paragraph. Simple story, no message, no violence, no mob scenes. When the movies have a story like this, they do it better than any medium there is.‚Äù (IMDB) Jimmy makes us feel good in this film. He has a great humour and is part of some wonderful moments. I love the part when he dances with Donna Reed and then they fall in the pool! Of course, there are some sadder moments and, here, James Stewart plays a sad and angry George Bailey just as well as he plays a happy and funny George Bailey. I can‚Äôt imagine some other actors playing this character. James Stewart was so perfect for the part and we know that he was one of Frank Capra‚Äôs favourite actors.

I just talked to you about Vertigo and It‚Äôs a Wonderful Life. Well, because of those two films, I think that Jimmy was very talented to express the feeling of fear. And that‚Äôs kind of fascinating. That means he‚Äôs an actor who can share strong feelings only with his eyes or facial expressions. In Vertigo, I‚Äôm referring to the moment when he wakes up from his bad dream. For It‚Äôs a Wonderful Life, I‚Äôm referring to the scene where he is on the bridge and looks at the water‚Ä¶ Jimmy really could express any emotions and always be convincing. I can‚Äôt talk to you about all the James Stewart‚Äôs films I‚Äôve seen, but here is a quick overview of his performances for each one of the 11 other films, the ones I haven‚Äôt talked about yet:

In Rear Window, Jimmy has nothing to do except to spy his neighbours. He then discovers something terrible about one of them. In the beginning, he plays someone with a great sense of humour. He seems not to care much about his girlfriend but when she‚Äôs in danger, Jimmy perfectly expresses the feeling of anxiety.

In Harvey, Jimmy couldn‚Äôt be more adorable. He has an imaginary friend, a big Rabbit named Harvey. His family think he‚Äôs crazy but he‚Äôs the one who seems to enjoy life the most.

In The Spirit of Saint-Louis, some may think he was not the perfect Charles Lindberg, but I say I was happy to see another picture with him. His best acting talent in this film belongs to the scenes where he is alone in his plane with the only company of a little fly. He is also quite funny in some of the flashback scenes.

In The Man Who Knew Too Much, James learns a terrible secret and then has to save his son with his wife. He plays a good father who will do anything to save his family. He plays an ordinary man who will live extraordinary adventures.

In Mr. Smith Goes To Washington, Jimmy is a model for the youth. He plays a strong young man who proves us that, with perseverance, we can always reach our objectives. One of my favourite moments in this film is when he visits Washington DC. He is so fascinated and looks like a little boy. üôÇ

In The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, James Stewart is a judge who wants to protect a city. He is a wise man and will teach to a beautiful girl how to write and read. When we watch this film, we would like to go in the screen to protect him from the mean Liberty Valence.

In The Philadelphia Story, Jimmy is a journalist who makes a wonderful team with Ruth Hussey who plays a photographer. He won the Oscar and was hilarious, especially in the scene where he is drunk.

In How the West Was Won. Jimmy is a trapper. I can‚Äôt say it was the perfect role for him, but it remains an interesting performance to watch.

In The Shop Around the Corner, Jimmy loves a girl and doesn‚Äôt really appreciate her at the same time. Well, he thinks those two feelings belong to two different girls but he won‚Äôt take long to discover that it is the same girl and will try to fix things.

In Destry Rides Again, Jimmy is welcomed in a town by some people who are not very kind to him because he is not the person they were expecting. One more time, he proves us that he is a real hero. Just like in The Man Who Shot Liberty Valence, he believes that gunfights are not the perfect solution to solve a problem. Peace Jimmy.

Finally, in Rope, James Stewart is invited to a morbid dinner where he discovers with horror that his two students have done something unforgivable. He plays there a fascinating character with whom we would like to discuss for hours.

James Stewart is certainly one of the most iconic Hollywood stars. He will always be remembered and known as a true legend. He‚Äôs my favourite but he is the favourite of many persons. Is it possible not to like James Stewart?

Long life to your memory Jimmy!
